knimeNode.name: Unpivoting
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node rotates the selected columns from the input table to rows and duplicates at the same time the remaining input columns by appending them to each corresponding output row.

fullDescription.intro:
This node rotates the selected columns from the input table to rows and duplicates at the same time the remaining input columns by appending them to each corresponding output row. Example:
Input: Value1 Value2 Value3 Extra1 Extra2 Extra3 Output: Value1 Extra1 Extra2 Extra3 Value2 Extra1 Extra2 Extra3 Value3 Extra1 Extra2 Extra3

tab.name: Value columns
tab.option: This list contains the names of the columns that are rotated into one single column.

tab.name: Retained columns
tab.option: This list contains the column names of the columns which are duplicated by the number of selected value columns.

tab.name: Manual Selection
tab.option: Use one of these fields to filter either the Include or Exclude list for certain column names or name substrings.

Use these buttons to move columns between the Include and Exclude list. Single-arrow buttons will move all selected columns. Double-arrow buttons will move all columns (filtering is taken into account).

Select this option to enforce the current inclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. If some of the included columns are not available anymore, a warning is displayed. (New columns will automatically be added to the exclusion list.)

Select this option to enforce the current exclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. If some of the excluded columns are not available anymore, a warning is displayed. (New columns will automatically be added to the inclusion list.)

tab.name: Wildcard/Regex Selection
tab.option: Type a search pattern which matches columns to move into the Include or Exclude list. Which list is used can be specified. You can use either Wildcards ('?' matching any character, '*' matching a sequence of any characters) or Regex. You can specify whether your pattern should be case sensitive.

tab.name: Type Selection
tab.option: Select the column types that you want to include. Column types that are currently not present are depicted in italic.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Select, if hiliting is enabled between input and output data.
Skip all rows containing missing cells in selected value column(s).

ports.inPort: Input table with at least on value column for the unpivoting operation.
ports.outPort: Unpivoting table with duplicated columns together with one rotated value column and their corresponding column names.
